item.title: Windows
item.description:
Powershell command in Windows

Table of Contents
  • Clear the screen
  • Info
    • Files in current folder
    • Current pathway
    • Change path
    • GPU status
    • Memory chip
  • Install anaconda on Powershell

Clear the screen

cls

Info

Files in current folder

dir

Current pathway

chdir

Change path

cd <dir>

GPU status

cd C:\Program Files\NVIDIA Corporation\NVSMI
nvidia-smi

Memory chip

wmic memorychip get /value

Install anaconda on Powershell

item.title: WSL
item.description:
Installation method and usage of WSL on Windows

Table of Contents
  • Installation
  • Usage
    • See the installed Linux distribution
    • See the available versions to install
    • Install multipie Linux distribution
    • Import the distribution
    • Export the distribution
    • Remove the distribution
    • Change default Linux distribution
    • Shut down all the distributions
    • Shut down specific distribution
    • Update wsl
    • Check the status of wsl
    • Check the version of wsl
    • Check IP address
    • Open help menu
    • Start up from /home/user
    • Exit the running wsl
    • Open VS Code via WSL
    • Adjust wsl version
    • Mount the disk
    • Unmount the disk
  • Map USB device from Windows to Linux
    • Installation on windows
    • Installation on Liunx
    • Usage
  • Install multipie wsl distributions
  • Install cuda in wsl

Installation

Mircosoft official document

wsl --install

Usage

See the installed Linux distribution

wsl --list --verbose or wsl -l -v

See the available versions to install

wsl --list --online or wsl -l -v

Install multipie Linux distribution

wsl --install -d <distribution_name>

Import the distribution

wsl --import <distribution_name> <install_location> <file_name>

Export the distribution

wsl --export <distribution_name> <file_name>

Remove the distribution

wsl --unregister <distribution_name>

Change default Linux distribution

wsl --set-default <distribution_name>

Shut down all the distributions

wsl --shutdown

Shut down specific distribution

wsl --terminate <distribution_name>

Update wsl

wsl --update

Check the status of wsl

wsl --status

Check the version of wsl

wsl --version

Check IP address

The address of Linux

wsl hostname -i

The address of Windows

cat /etc/resolv.conf

Open help menu

wsl --help

Start up from /home/user

wsl ~

Exit the running wsl

Press Ctrl+A+D at the same time

Open VS Code via WSL

code .

Adjust wsl version

wsl --set-version <distribution_name> <version_number>

<version_number> here is 1 or 2

Mount the disk

wsl --mount <disk_path>

Unmount the disk

wsl --unmount <disk_path>

Map USB device from Windows to Linux

Mircosoft Document

CSDN link

Installation on windows

  1. Open usbipd-win and download the up-to-date released .msi file
  2. Install the downloaded file

Installation on Liunx

sudo apt install linux-tools-generic hwdata

sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/local/bin/usbip usbip /usr/lib/linux-tools/*-generic/usbip 20

Usage

  1. Open PowerShell and type in usbipd wsl list to check all the connected USB device
  2. Find the busid of needed device and type usbipd wsl attach --busid <busid> in PowerShell
  3. Open WSL and type in lsusb to check if the need device has connected to the wsl or not
  4. When we need to disconnect the needed device from wsl, type usbipd wsl detach --busid <busid>

Install multipie wsl distributions

  1. Install wsl2 with wsl --install
  2. Open ubuntu wsl2 images and download an image of needed version
  3. Open PowerShell and type in wsl --import <Distribution Name> <Installation Folder> <Ubuntu WSL2 Image Tarball path>
  4. Type wsl -l -v to check if the installation is successful or not
  5. Use wsl -d <distribution_name> to login the distribution we just installed
  6. Type in NEW_USER=<USERNAME> to create a new account
  7. Input useradd -m -G sudo -s /bin/bash "$NEW_USER" + passwd "$NEW_USER" and set a password for our new account
  8. Input the code below to set our new user as the default one
tee /etc/wsl.conf <<_EOF
    [user]
    default=${NEW_USER}
    _EOF
  1. Press Ctrl + A + D at the same time to exit the distribution
  2. Input wsl --terminate <distribution_name and wsl -d <distribution_name> to restart the installed distribution
  3. And find that we succeed in creating a new distribution

Install cuda in wsl

NVIDIA Documents

wget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/wsl-ubuntu/x86_64/cuda-wsl-ubuntu.pin

sudo mv cuda-wsl-ubuntu.pin /etc/apt/preferences.d/cuda-repository-pin-600

wget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/12.2.2/local_installers/cuda-repo-wsl-ubuntu-12-2-local_12.2.2-1_amd64.deb

sudo dpkg -i cuda-repo-wsl-ubuntu-12-2-local_12.2.2-1_amd64.deb

sudo cp /var/cuda-repo-wsl-ubuntu-12-2-local/cuda-*-keyring.gpg /usr/share/keyrings/

sudo apt-get update

sudo apt-get -y install cuda

sudo ln -s /usr/lib/wsl/lib/libcuda.so.1 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcuda.so

item.title: Messy
item.description:
Notes

Python

Move multipie lines right/left

Left

Select the needed content and press Tab

Right

Select the needed content and press Shift and Tab at the same time

Colab

https://colab.research.google.com/github/iErics/gd-utils/blob/master/Colab_gd_utils.ipynb

function ConnectButton(){
    console.log("Connect pushed"); 
    document.querySelector("#connect").click() 
}
setInterval(ConnectButton,60000);

Use visdom over remote server

This note is for those who need run their codes on remote server but finding that they could NOT be able to get access to visdom’s monitor as before. So we need to mapping the service of visdom to our local workspace over the remote server.

Steps:

  1. Open the remote server and type tmux new -s <session-name> to open a new backstage process (screen could does this too)
  2. Activate the specific conda env you are using (if your code runs on conda env) and type python -m visdom.server to open a local visdom server
  3. Open the terminal of local device and type ssh -L 8097:127.0.0.1:8097 <username>@<server_address> or ssh -L 8097:localhost:8097 <username>@<server_address> while 8097 is as an example of port id.
  4. When you successfully get access to your remote server, open the page 127.0.0.1:8097 or localhost:8097

When you want to terminate the visdom’s mapping, just kill the process of visdom on the remote server, e.g. tmux kill-session -t <session-name>

Windows

Set clock into UTC mode

Make Windows 10’s BIOS hardware time treat Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) by changing the registry value RealTimeIsUniversal key

With Regedit

  1. Press Win + R at the same time
  2. Input regedit and press Enter
  3. Find the path \HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\TimeZoneInformation
  4. Set RealTimeIsUniversal to 1 if this value already exists.
  5. New a QWORD(for system of 32-bit, use DWORD instead) variable with a name of RealTimeIsUniversal and whose value could also be set as 1

With PowerShell

  1. Open terminal with Administrator rights
  2. Input reg add "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\TimeZoneInformation" /v RealTimeIsUniversal /d 1 /t REG_QWORD /f (for system of 32-bit, use DWORD instead)
  3. Press Enter

Using multi-moniter to view same project in VS Code

Ctrl + Shift + P and input the content below:

Workspace: Duplicate As Workspace in New Window

The installation of Windows11 is stuck by connecting to network

  1. Press Shift+F10 to open a terminal.
  2. Input oobe\bypassnro

The computer will restart soon and there will be an option for ‘I haven’t Interest to connect’
